item.title: Random Grouping by Int Division
item.description: One way to assign a random grouping is to perform modulo operation. library(dplyr) library(ggplot2) # Generate N numbers randnums <- function(n, min = 0, max = 10000){ sample(x = c(min:max), size = n, replace = FALSE) } nums <- randnums(1000) # Find int division mods <- nums %% 3 # Check groupings table(mods) ## mods ## 0 1 2 ## 302 345 353 # Repeat many times reps <- purrr::map(1:2000, ~table(randnums(1000) %% 3)) reps %>% unlist() %>% bind_cols(mod = rep(c(0, 1, 2), 2000), val = .
